Package algorithms.optimization

Class LinearProgramming.FormTuple

java.lang.Object
algorithms.optimization.LinearProgramming.FormTuple
Direct Known Subclasses:
LinearProgramming.SlackForm, LinearProgramming.StandardForm
Enclosing class:
LinearProgramming
public abstract static class LinearProgramming.FormTuple extends Object
example Standard Form: Find numbers x1,...xn: objective : maximize c^T*x = summation_j=1:n(cj*xj) constraints : subject to: A*x .leq. b = summation_j=1:n(aij*xj) .leq. bi for i=1:m constraints : xj .geq. 0 for j=1:n the later is a nonnegativity constraint where c1...cn; b1,...bm; and aij are real numbers.

  • Constructor Details

    • FormTuple

      public FormTuple(double[][] a, double[] b, double[] c, double v)
      Parameters:
      a - mXn matrix of constraint coefficients. Careful with the signs of the values for the SlackForm. see eqn (29.43) of Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein 
       x_i = b_i - summation_j(a_i_j*x_j) for i in bIndices.
      b - m-dimensional vector of constraint inequalities
      c - n-dimensional vector of objective coefficients.
      v - an optional term sometimes present in the objective. can be 0 if no v is used.

  • Method Details

    • convertMinimizationToMaximiation

      public void convertMinimizationToMaximiation()
      convert the c coefficients from minimization coefficients to maximization coefficients by multiplying them by -1.

    • evaluateObjective

      public abstract double evaluateObjective()
      Returns:

    • computeBasicSolution

      public abstract double[] computeBasicSolution()
      using the present forms, sets all rhs x's to 0 to solve for the lhs x's. The x vector is returned.
      Returns:
